title: matplotlib demo
text:
Hello, this page will showcase the dashboard for issues
Hello, this page will showcase the main dashboard!

#Initializing Workspace
import requests
import datetime
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

#API Function
def fetch_api(endpoint):
 url = f"https://api.github.com/repos/jspsych/jsPsych/{endpoint}"
 final_data=[]
 while url:
  response = requests.get(url)
  data = response.json()
  for item in data:
    final_data.append(item)
  if 'next' in response.links:
    url = response.links['next']['url']
  else:
    break

  return final_data


ret_data = fetch_api(f"issues?false&state=all&per_page=100")
ret_data

  'body': 'Hi community, just wondering if anyone has a clue on this? Thank you very much!\n\nI tried to display stimuli_screen (displayed every trial in test_stimuli) first and then ask jsych to retrive the data to give feedback to participants in my next trial: feedback_screen, but it seems the timing is a problem here if I set it short now 1500ms for stimuli_screen. Sometimes, for some letters, there no feedback at all.  If I set it 5s for stimuli_screen, it is mostly fine, but if I participants respond very late, also run into this issue. I guess it is because jspsych does not have enough time to retrieve the data before the next feedback_screen come along?\nor alternatively, how do you give feedback based on the rule of your experiment rather than direct feedback?\n```\n\n\n`for (var i = 0; i < test_stimuli.length; i++) {\n        let stimuli_screen_practice = {\n            type: jsPsychCategorizeHtml,\n            stimulus: test_stimuli[i].stimulus,\n            data: test_stimuli[i].data,\n            key_answer: test_stimuli[i].correct_key,\n            stimulus_duration: 1500,\n            trial_duration: 1500,\n            show_feedback_on_timeout: false,\n            timeout_message: \' \',\n            feedback_duration: 0,\n            correct_text: \' \',\n            show_stim_with_feedback: false,\n            incorrect_text: \' \',\n        };\n\n\n\n\n\n        let feedback_screen_practice = {\n            type: jsPsychHtmlKeyboardResponse,\n            stimulus: function () {\n  \n                let last_trial_data = jsPsych.data.get().last(1).values()[0] \n\n                let response = last_trial_data.response \n                let correct_key = last_trial_data.correct_key \n                let h12AX = last_trial_data.conditionalDetect \n\n\n\n      \n                if (response) response = response.toUpperCase();\n\n      \n                if (!response) {\n                    return "<p style=\'color:red;\'>Time out!</p>";\n                }\n\n           \n                if (response === correct_key) {\n                    return "<p style=\'color:green;\'>Correct!</p>";\n                }\n\n     \n                if (correct_key === "K" && response === "D" ) {\n                    return "<p style=\'color:red;\'>Missed the match!</p>";\n                }\n\n                if (correct_key === "D" && response === "K" ) {\n                    return "<p style=\'color:red;\'>Not a match!</p>";\n                }\n\n                return "<p style=\'color:red;\'>Incorrect press!</p>";\n            },\n\n            stimulus_duration: 750,\n            trial_duration: 750,\n            response_ends_trial: false,\n\n            data: { task: \'feedback\', practice: true }\n        };\n\n\n        test.push(stimuli_screen_practice);\n        test.push(feedback_screen_practice);\n    }\n\nvar practice = { timeline: test };\n`\n```',

  'body': "This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.\n\n\n# Releases\n## @jspsych/config@3.2.2\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3488](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3488) [`64a01292c350b5f6fd9f3f2e0dad5124262d53c9`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/64a01292c350b5f6fd9f3f2e0dad5124262d53c9) Thanks [@jodeleeuw](https://github.com/jodeleeuw)! - Replaces the dependency on `canvas` in `@jspsych/config` with `jest-canvas-mock`.\n\n-   [#3484](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3484) [`e710cb01e8ab2f992d0be902016e3e6540197f67`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/e710cb01e8ab2f992d0be902016e3e6540197f67) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - Patches some edge cases for `getCitations` and the build process that reads CITATION.CFF files to include citation info\n\n## jspsych@8.2.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3484](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3484) [`e710cb01e8ab2f992d0be902016e3e6540197f67`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/e710cb01e8ab2f992d0be902016e3e6540197f67) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - Patches some edge cases for `getCitations` and the build process that reads CITATION.CFF files to include citation info\n",

  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': "Hi!\n\nI have set up my jsPsych experiment to run on Pavlovia, and it works perfectly fine locally. However, when I follow the instructions to modify the timeline ([see here](https://pavlovia.org/docs/experiments/create-jsPsych)) and try to pilot the experiment on Pavlovia, I only see a blank page. Ive read that some variables (e.g., jsPsych.init) no longer work with the latest version, but even after updating the script, it still doesn't run.\n\nHeres the link to the experiment: https://gitlab.pavlovia.org/giulialoca18/jspsych_bwsnorms/-/blob/master/index.html . \n\nI've tried several potential solutions, and occasionally, I encounter errors related to the plugins I added (although no error is shown in this latest version of the code). I suspect the issue may be linked to the plugins or to the connection with the server.\n\nCould anyone help me identify the problem or suggest which part of the script I should check or modify? Could this issue be related to conflicting versions of jsPsych and Pavlovia?\n\nThank you in advance for your help! \nGiulia",

   'merged_at': '2025-01-10T21:24:44Z'},
  'body': "this PR moves any notable use of `document.querySelector(...)` to `displayElement.querySelector(...)`. this is done in order to rollback the setup file for clearing the DOM after each step, which is necessary as Jest doesn't automatically do that between individual tests in a testing file. now instead of having to potentially deal with multiple jsPsych elements with unintended side effects, each tests will for sure act in their own `displayElement`. (closes #3434)",

If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.\n\n\n# Releases\n## @jspsych/config@3.2.0\n\n### Minor Changes\n\n-   [#3385](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3385) [`3948fdc0ac176584fe4b8fe0b9cca5ed6e8b3afc`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/3948fdc0ac176584fe4b8fe0b9cca5ed6e8b3afc) Thanks [@cherriechang](https://github.com/cherriechang)! - Added citations property to info field of all plugins/extensions in two citation formats (apa, bibtex); added getCitations() as function in jsPsych package allowing user to generate citations by passing an array of plugins/extensions by name as first input and citation format as string as second input; changed template of plugins/extensions to contain citations field by default; citations for each plugin/extension are automatically generated from .cff file (if any) at its folder's root during build process; getCitations() prints out citations in the form of a string separating each citation with newline character, and always prints the jsPsych library citation first.\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3482](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3482) [`a733fc685c8d1a3f1a9dea25bd4c70940885c6e9`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/a733fc685c8d1a3f1a9dea25bd4c70940885c6e9) Thanks [@jodeleeuw](https://github.com/jodeleeuw)!   'author_association': 'NONE',
  'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0},
  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': 'Hi!\r\n\r\nI want to have trials where people have to answer a yes/no question about a sentence and iff they say \'yes\' they get a follow up question about the same sentence (a specific question for that sentence). The trial structure is built by using timeline variables. \r\n\r\nI am struggling with getting a conditional function that works like this, given that I need to specify the timelineVariable for each task. Below is my code. I want the inference to be conditional on the answer on acceptability. Does someone have some insights on how to do it? Thanks in advance!\r\n\r\n```\r\nconst acceptability = \r\n    {\r\n      type: jsPsychHtmlButtonResponse,\r\n      stimulus: function () {\r\n        var html = `\r\n          <div> \r\n          <p> ${jsPsych.evaluateTimelineVariable(\'Sentence\')} </p>\r\n          <p>Te suena natural esta oracin?</p>\r\n          </div>`;\r\n        return html;\r\n      },\r\n      choices: [\'No\', \'Meh\', \'S\'],\r\n      on_finish: function (data) {\r\n        // Store response for conditional logic\r\n        data.proceed_to_inference = data.response === 2; // 2 corresponds to "S"\r\n      }\r\n    }; \r\n\r\nconst inference = {\r\n    type: jsPsychSurveyLikert,\r\n    questions: [\r\n            {\r\n                prompt: \'\',\r\n                labels: [\r\n                    \'1\',\r\n                    \'2\',\r\n                    \'3\',\r\n                    \'4\',\r\n                    \'5\'\r\n                ],\r\n                required: true\r\n            }\r\n        ],\r\n        scale_width: 500, // Largeur de l\'chelle\r\n        preamble: function(){\r\n            var html = `\r\n            <div> \r\n            <p> ${jsPsych.evaluateTimelineVariable(\'Sentence\')} </p>\r\n            <p> ${jsPsych.evaluateTimelineVariable(\'Question\')}</p>\r\n            </div>`\r\n            return html},\r\n        button_label: \'Continuar\',\r\n}\r\n\r\nconst trials = {\r\n    timeline : [acceptability, inference],\r\n    timeline_variables: trials_all\r\n}    \r\n```\r\n',

  'body': "This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.\n\n\n# Releases\n## @jspsych/plugin-cloze@2.1.0\n\n### Minor Changes\n\n-   [#2846](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/2846) [`703b7243`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/703b724376ec66c09967ac6e1bb87ecce6b33b74) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - adds support for multiple correct answers, case sensitivity, and autofocus.\n\n## @jspsych/config@3.1.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3396](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3396) [`d683396e`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/d683396e5e6465f454625ec99675f76959a99e9b) Thanks [@bjoluc](https://github.com/bjoluc)! - Change broken selection in enable_button_after parameter\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-survey@2.0.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3451](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3451) [`7ffc644d`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/7ffc644d0469cb5625efc5f1bb043d3aee22c501) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - fix `response` data type to be just `ParameterType.OBJECT`\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-survey-html-form@2.0.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3451](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3451) [`7ffc644d`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/7ffc644d0469cb5625efc5f1bb043d3aee22c501) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - fix `response` data type to be just `ParameterType.OBJECT`\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-survey-multi-choice@2.0.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3451](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3451) [`7ffc644d`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/7ffc644d0469cb5625efc5f1bb043d3aee22c501) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)!   'body': "This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.\n\n\n# Releases\n## @jspsych/config@3.1.0\n\n### Minor Changes\n\n-   [#3435](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3435) [`3de5aad4`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/3de5aad43b538be56a3957be5beb6e9910b74267) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - update to force the dom to clear after each individual test\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-visual-search-circle@2.1.0\n\n### Minor Changes\n\n-   [#2897](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/2897) [`8759217f`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/8759217f0ef0c1d127ca58440d1cbe5f152dbde5) Thanks [@jodeleeuw](https://github.com/jodeleeuw)! - Add options (`randomize_item_locations` and `location_first_item`) to allow for fixed locations of the item array across trials.\n",

  'title': 'record-video extension and html-video-response misparse the base64 string when include_audio is true in init_camera.',
  'user': {'login': 'kschuler',
   'id': 6099948,
   'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjYwOTk5NDg=',
   'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6099948?v=4',
   'gravatar_id': '',

   'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kschuler/orgs',
   'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kschuler/repos',
   'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kschuler/events{/privacy}',

  'labels': [],
  'state': 'open',
  'locked': False,
  'assignee': None,
  'assignees': [],
  'milestone': None,
  'comments': 0,
  'created_at': '2024-11-23T20:46:12Z',
  'updated_at': '2024-11-23T20:46:12Z',
  'closed_at': None,
  'author_association': 'NONE',
  'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0},
  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': 'The record-video extension (and html-video-response) should record audio and video when init-camera has the parameter include_audio: true. \n\nBut when include_audio is true, the base64data is no longer accessible due to a misparse of the string. You get something like the string "audiocodecyouspecified;base64" instead of the base64Data. I suspect the additional metadata relating to the audio codec is messing up this part of the plugin: \n\n\n```\nprivate updateData() {\n    const data = new Blob(this.recordedChunks, {\n      type: this.recorder.mimeType,\n    });\n    const reader = new FileReader();\n    reader.addEventListener("load", () => {\n      const base64 = (reader.result as string).split(",")[1];\n      this.currentTrialData.record_video_data = base64;\n      if (this.onUpdateCallback) {\n        this.onUpdateCallback();\n      }\n    });\n    reader.readAsDataURL(data);\n  }\n}\n\n```\n\nMaybe something as simple as changing `.split(",")[1]` with  `.split("base64,")[1]` (or similar) would fix the misparse issue?',
  'closed_by': None,

  'body': "This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.\n\n\n# Releases\n## jspsych@8.1.0\n\n### Minor Changes\n\n-   [#3426](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3426) [`bfeeea3a`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/bfeeea3ab217f9d7f2bcb1e8f2dcc3f0e59761a7) Thanks [@bjoluc](https://github.com/bjoluc)! - We added a feature that allows users to dynamically add or remove trials or nested timelines to a timeline array during runtime.\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-audio-button-response@2.0.2\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3443](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3443) [`13731787`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/137317878e88cf5d934f0010f4dd1cf68d8ae8e7) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - annotate missing stimulus data field\n",

  'body': 'hi all, this PR is just a simple documentation revision. this contains:\r\n* tackling v8 migration (removing old, deprecated function docs such as progress bar (closes #3383), adding audio migration)\r\n* documentation styling errors (fixes #3318, among other touch-ups)\r\n* adding a new section for parameter types (closes #3045)\r\n* redoes video tutorials into community tutorials, adding prominent online tutorial links to the website (closes #3265)\r\n* a little bit of expansion on the extensions section to bring more in line with our plugins extension\r\n\r\n',

  'body': 'Hi!\r\n\r\nI am conducting an offline experiment and saving data locally. I am able to save the data at the end of the experiment, using the `on_finish` function. I am wondering if there is a way to save the data before the end, for instance if the participant does not finish the experiment. I tried using the `on_close` function, but that does not work.\r\n\r\nThank you!\r\n\r\nCatherine',

  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': 'Hi @becky-gilbert,\r\n\r\nFour years ago, you helped me with the `trial_ends_after_audio` parameter in the psychophysics plugin (see discussion https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/discussions/1158). The plugin (and jspsych) has been updated since then, so I was wondering if you could help me once more with the same issue. Im using version 3.7.0 of the psychophysics plugin and version 7.3.2 of jspsych. Ill be running the experiment offline.\r\n\r\nThank you!\r\n\r\nCatherine',

  'pull_request': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/jspsych/jsPsych/pulls/3435',
   'html_url': 'https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3435',
   'diff_url': 'https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3435.diff',
   'patch_url': 'https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3435.patch',
   'merged_at': '2024-11-30T15:15:15Z'},
  'body': "this PR clears the dom after every individual test. the expected pattern of using `startTimeline` in the `test-utils` package is to deconstruct the tuple given and take out `displayElement` in order to directly query the experiment's display element. however, some plugins still query `document` directly, which isn't optimal as the dom is not cleared, meaning there are multiple jsPsych display elements on the dom at a given time. this results in some interesting edge cases where the wrong button is queried, or one test failing means every next test that interacts with the `document` fails.\r\n\r\nthis is a small, simple update in order to allow tests to both query `document` and `displayElement` without having to deal with this behavior by making sure the DOM is wiped before each individual test.",
  'closed_by': {'login': 'jodeleeuw',
   'id': 595524,

  'body': "This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.\n\n\n# Releases\n## @jspsych/plugin-animation@2.0.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3432](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3432) [`484300c4`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/484300c49a8f8c54de705b2fb7b7739ac648f9f2) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - fix data values with `COMPLEX` type to use proper metadata syntax\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-free-sort@2.0.2\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3432](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3432) [`484300c4`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/484300c49a8f8c54de705b2fb7b7739ac648f9f2) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - fix data values with `COMPLEX` type to use proper metadata syntax\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-instructions@2.0.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3432](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3432) [`484300c4`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/484300c49a8f8c54de705b2fb7b7739ac648f9f2) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - fix data values with `COMPLEX` type to use proper metadata syntax\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-maxdiff@2.0.2\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3432](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3432) [`484300c4`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/484300c49a8f8c54de705b2fb7b7739ac648f9f2) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - fix data values with `COMPLEX` type to use proper metadata syntax\n\n## @jspsych/plugin-sketchpad@2.0.2\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3432](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3432) [`484300c4`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/484300c49a8f8c54de705b2fb7b7739ac648f9f2) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - fix data values with `COMPLEX` type to use proper metadata syntax\n",

   'merged_at': '2024-11-20T18:48:45Z'},
  'body': "Prior to this, trials (or nested timelines) that were added to a timeline description while the experiment was running would be ignored. This PR makes `Timeline` objects instantiate their child nodes incrementally before running them, thus accounting for dynamically added/removed trials and timelines.\r\n\r\nCloses #3379.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\nWhile I'm confident in the implementation, I'm submitting this as a draft for now because it lacks docs updates and a changeset (for which I don't have time ATM). @jspsych/core Feel free to complete this and release it!\r\n\r\nI'm also not sure to which extent modifications to a JS array are reflected while iterating over it in a `for ... of` loop  it would be interesting to toy around with this a bit. Pushing elements to the end obviously works (and is the primary use case anyway), but what about removing elements prior to the current one? Index-based iteration would skip an element then  but maybe  `for ... of` doesn't?",
  'closed_by': {'login': 'jodeleeuw',
   'id': 595524,
   'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjU5NTUyNA==',
   'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/595524?v=4',

  'title': "How to set timeline_variables to be a function that filters out stimuli based on participant's previous answers",
  'user': {'login': 'AnafNeves',
   'id': 147059054,
   'node_id': 'U_kgDOCMPxbg',
   'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/147059054?v=4',

  'author_association': 'NONE',
  'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0},
  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': "I am working with @DominiqueMakowski to try to set up an experiment in which we need to filter an array of stimuli based on the demographic answers given by the participant at the beginning of the experiment.\r\n\r\nHowever, setting timeline variable to be a function does not seem to work:\r\n\r\n```js\r\ntimeline.push({\r\n        timeline_variables: function() {return new_stimuli_list}, // new_stimuli_list being created on the on_finish of a previous phase\r\n        timeline: [\r\n            fixactioncross,\r\n            showimage,\r\n        ],\r\n    }\r\n)\r\n```\r\n\r\nWe tried as an alternative to put the whole timeline object into a function with the hope that that function would only be called after the demographic phase:\r\n\r\n```js\r\nfunction expe_trials() {\r\n    return {\r\n        timeline_variables: function() {return new_stimuli_list}, // new_stimuli_list being created on the on_finish of a previous phase\r\n        timeline: [\r\n            fixactioncross,\r\n            showimage,\r\n        ],\r\n    }\r\n}\r\ntimeline.push(expe_trials())\r\n```\r\n\r\nBut that didn't do the trick either, as the function is called immediately on script initialization.\r\n\r\nWhat is the best way to dynamically filter the timeline__variable? Thanks\r\n\r\n",

  'body': 'Hi,\r\n\r\nAccording to the "image-slider-response" (ver. 2.0.0.) documentation, I should get the user\'s choice for the slider\'s position in my data file. Yet, I don\'t get any values besides "slider_start".   'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0},
  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': 'While updating a task programmed in jsPsych 7.x to 8.x, I found that supplying the option "choices: jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'choices\')" to the audio-button-response plugin now causes the following error:\r\n\r\nA non-array value (`function() { return fnGetImmediate(getArg); }`) was provided for the array parameter "choices" in the "audio-button-response" plugin. Please make sure that "choices" is an array.\r\n\r\nThe cause of this seems to be the newly strict handling of "array: true" for plugin parameters. It\'s true - the value here will be a function, not an array. \r\n\r\nBut surely when a plugin sets "array: true", it should not break the use of timeline variables with that parameter?',
  'closed_by': None,

  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': 'Hi I am coding an online experiment. During debugging I notice that the on_timeline_start function only runs once within a timeline node while the the repetition was indicated more than 1. This does not comply with the documentation in the [website](https://www.jspsych.org/6.3/overview/callbacks/#on_timeline_finish)\r\n\r\n> The on_timeline_start callback can be declared in a timeline node. The callback will be triggered when the timeline starts during the experiment, including when timeline_variables, loop_function, or sample options are used. If a conditional_function is used, then the conditional function will execute first, and the on_timeline_start function will only execute if the conditional function returns true. If the repetitions option is used, this function will be triggered at the start of every repetition.\r\n\r\nthe code:\r\n<img width="411" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4e8dc33e-b481-40bd-9f1e-1c1d7cf34f87">\r\nthe test: only trigger once\r\n<img width="240" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4e90367d-91c0-4bcd-94fa-1ebe6d8705d7">\r\n',
  'closed_by': None,

  'body': 'I have a questionnaire with 24 items that I am currently presenting as a single item on each page as below: \r\n\r\n`const CSTQ_procedure = {\r\n  timeline: [\r\n    {\r\n            type: \'survey-likert\',\r\n            questions: [{\r\n                prompt: jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'question\'),\r\n                function(){\r\n                const html = `\r\n                    <pstyle="text-align: center;"><font size="+3>"${jsPsych.evaluateTimelineVariable(\'question\')}"</p>`;\r\n                return html;\r\n            }, \r\n            labels: likert_labels,\r\n            required: true\r\n            }],\r\n            scale_width: 1000,\r\n      data: {\r\n        id: jsPsych.timelineVariable("id"),\r\n        question: jsPsych.timelineVariable("question"),\r\n        trial_part: \'CSTQ_questionnaire\'\r\n      },\r\n    }\r\n  ], \r\n  timeline_variables: [\r\n  {id: 1, question: "It is important to be loyal to your beliefs even when evidence is brought to bear against them."},\r\n  {id: 2, question: "Whether something feels true is more important than evidence"},\r\n  {id: 3, question: "Just because evidence conflicts with my current beliefs does not mean my beliefs are wrong"},\r\n  {id: 4, question: "There may be evidence that goes against what you believe but that does not mean you have to change your beliefs"},\r\n  {id: 5, question: "Even if there is concrete evidence against what you believe to be true, it is OK to maintain cherished beliefs."},\r\n  {id: 6, question: "Regardless of the topic, what you believe to be true is more important than evidence against your beliefs."},\r\n  {id: 7, question: "I think there are many wrong ways, but only one right way, to almost anything."},\r\n  {id: 8, question: "In my experience, the truth is often black and white."},\r\n  {id: 9, question: "Truth is never relative."},\r\n  {id: 10,question: "The truth does not change."},\r\n  {id: 11,question: "Either something is true or it is false; there is nothing in-between."},\r\n  {id: 12,question: "There is no middle ground between what is true and what is false."},\r\n  {id: 13,question: "I like to rely on my intuitive impressions."},\r\n  {id: 14,question: "I believe in trusting my hunches."},\r\n  {id: 15,question: "When I make decisions, I tend to rely on my intuition."},\r\n  {id: 16,question: \'Using my gut-feelings usually works well for me in figuring out problems in my life.\'},\r\n  {id: 17,question: "Intuition is the best guide in making decisions."},\r\n  {id: 18,question: "I often go by my instincts when deciding on a course of action."},\r\n  {id: 19,question: "Im not that good at figuring out complicated problems."},\r\n  {id: 20,question: "Thinking is not my idea of an enjoyable activity."},\r\n  {id: 21,question: "I try to avoid situations that require thinking in depth about something."},\r\n  {id: 22,question: "I am not a very analytical thinker."},\r\n  {id: 23,question: "Reasoning things out carefully is not one of my strong points."},\r\n  {id: 24,question: "Thinking hard and for a long time about something gives me little satisfaction."}\r\n],\r\n  randomize_order: true\r\n};`\r\n\r\nThis is a bit cumbersome for participants to click through as they need to click the Continue button as well. However, when I tried this the standard way then there are 24 items on a page. \r\n\r\nDoes anyone know of a way to present the items in blocks of 6 or 12 on a page but still randomise the order?\r\n\n```[tasklist]\n### Tasks\n```\n',

  'body': "Receiving the following warning in Google Chrome (129.0.6668.70) web inspector:\r\n\r\n> MediaAPI.ts:19 The AudioContext was not allowed to start. It must be resumed (or created) after a user gesture on the page. https://goo.gl/7K7WLu\r\n\r\nI understand the error occurs because browsers require interaction before allowing audio to play. **However, I can recreate the issue in a barebones experiment with no audio-related plugins, just a simple html-keyboard-response.**\r\n\r\n\r\nJavaScript:\r\n```js\r\nlet jsPsych = initJsPsych();\r\nlet timeline = [];\r\nlet welcomeTrial = {\r\n    type: jsPsychHtmlKeyboardResponse,\r\n    stimulus: `\r\n    <h1>Welcome to the Lexical Decision Task!</h1>\r\n\r\n    <p>In this experiment, you will be shown a series of characters and asked to categorize whether the characters make up a word or not.</p>\r\n    <p>There are three parts to this experiment.</p>\r\n    <p>Press SPACE to begin the first part.</p>\r\n    `,\r\n    choices: [' ']\r\n};\r\ntimeline.push(welcomeTrial);\r\njsPsych.run(timeline);\r\n```\r\n\r\nHTML:\r\n```html\r\n<!DOCTYPE html>\r\n<html>\r\n\r\n<head>\r\n    <title>Lexical Decision Task</title>\r\n    <link href=data:, rel=icon>\r\n\r\n    <link href='https://unpkg.com/jspsych/css/jspsych.css' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'>\r\n\r\n    <script src='https://unpkg.com/jspsych'></script>\r\n    <script src='https://unpkg.com/@jspsych/plugin-html-keyboard-response'></script>\r\n\r\n    <script src='experiment.js'></script>\r\n</head>\r\n\r\n<body></body>\r\n\r\n</html>\r\n```\r\n",
  'closed_by': None,

  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': "Hi folks,\r\nJust updating some code to version 8 (thanks again for all your work on this stuff, amazing!). One small thing - it looks like the CSS has been changed so that text (e.g. in html trials) goes hard up against the browser window edge, rather than having a little gap - it's hard to notice on most trials, but if you have e.g. a block of text for trial instructions it's quite noticeable. I am told it's fixable with something like \r\n\r\n.jspsych-content {\r\n    width: 95%\r\n}\r\n\r\nbut I'd guess in most cases the default should be to not go hard against the window edge?\r\n\r\nCheers!\r\nKenny Smith",
  'closed_by': None,

  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': 'I\'ve used the following code to run a simple timeline for presenting some text and obtaining a survey response with `v7.3.3.`\r\n\r\n```\r\nconst jsPsych = initJsPsych();\r\n        \r\n    \r\n    var association = {\r\n      type: jsPsychSurveyText,\r\n      questions: [ {prompt: jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'cue\')}],\r\n    };\r\n\r\n   \r\n    var association_procedure= {\r\n        timeline: [association],\r\n        timeline_variables: association_cues,\r\n        randomize_order: true,\r\n        repetitions: 3 \r\n    };   \r\n\r\n    jsPsych.run([association_procedure])\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe associated .js file with `association _cues` is as follows:\r\n\r\n```\r\nvar association_cues = [\r\n    {\r\n        cue: "foobly"\r\n    },\r\n    {\r\n        cue: "mipp"\r\n    },\r\n    {\r\n        cue: "dodish"\r\n    },\r\n    {\r\n        cue: "geck"\r\n    }\r\n]\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe code displays each of the `cue` values in random order three times when I use jsPsych version 7.3.3. but only loads one of the cues in version 8 (e.g., it only displays `foobly` and does not advance/end the procedure). \r\n\r\nAny ideas why? I\'m using the CDN-hosted scripts:\r\n\r\n```\r\n<head> \r\n        <title> EXPERIMENT </title>\r\n        <script src="https://unpkg.com/jspsych@7.3.3"></script>\r\n        <!--DOES NOT WORK: <script src="https://unpkg.com/jspsych@8.0.2"></script>-->\r\n        <link href="https://unpkg.com/jspsych@8.0.0/css/jspsych.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />\r\n        <script src="https://unpkg.com/@jspsych/plugin-survey-text@2.0.0"></script>\r\n        <script src="association.js"></script>\r\n</head>\r\n```',
  'closed_by': None,

  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': "### Discussed in https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/discussions/3397\r\n\r\n<div type='discussions-op-text'>\r\n\r\n<sup>Originally posted by **kschuler** September 14, 2024</sup>\r\nbrowser_check no longer displays the `exclusion_message` on true, I think because of this change in v8: \r\n\r\n```\r\nWe've renamed jsPsych.endExperiment() to jsPsych.abortExperiment().\r\n\r\nWe've renamed jsPsych.endCurrentTimeline() to jsPsych.abortCurrentTimeline().\r\n\r\n```\r\n\r\nbrowser_check is still trying to call jsPsych.endExperiment() </div>",

  'created_at': '2024-09-06T00:25:15Z',

  'author_association': 'NONE',
  'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0},
  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': "Hi,\r\n\r\nFirstly, thank you for your amazing work with jsPsych! I'm making more of a feature request  maybe with some time, I could try and contribute but it is currently not within my powers.\r\n\r\nI'm working on building an experiment that works via browsers on mobile devices, and coming up against issues with how the stimulus is displayed in portrait and landscape mode. Unfortunately, it appears that portrait and landscape are treated differently on different phone systems (iOS and Android). I was hoping a fix would be to use the `resize` or `browser-check` plugins but the click-and-drag function (i.e. when matching the rectangle to the credit card) doesn't seem to work on mobile devices.\r\n\r\nMy idea is to add some sort of plugin that allows the user to simply click rather than drag to resize the rectangle (like they would in `resize`) to cover most of the screen. This could then maybe set CSS style for the `jspsych-display-element` or determine a `scale-factor`, allowing tasks to essentially scale to any mobile device screen regardless of their handheld orientation.\r\n\r\n Sorry if this has been brought up elsewhere  I couldn't see to find any related issues on this. In the meantime, I'm happy on restyling the CSS/HTML of my stimulus to make it look okay on devices (hopefully!)\r\n \r\n Kindly,\r\n William",
  'closed_by': None,

  'body': 'The documentation on [timelines](https://www.jspsych.org/v7/overview/timeline/) provides an example section on dynamic parameters with anonymous functions, which allows the user to access potentially multiple timeline variables and combine them into one parameter for a plugin. \r\n\r\nHowever I can\'t get the example code provided in the documentation to work: Even wrapped in an anonymous function, the `jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'myVariable\')` still just returns the object, so instead of displaying e.g. a string (as in the example below) it displays [object Object]. \r\n\r\nThe minimum example here is just copied from the docs. When I paste it into a fresh timeline the third plugin in the procedure results in a trial that just says [object Object] for the `name` part. The `img src =` part also does not work: from the \'file not found\' error in the console I can see that it\'s trying to load an image called `.../[object%20Object]`. \r\n\r\n\r\n```\r\nvar face_name_procedure = {\r\n    timeline: [\r\n        {\r\n            type: jsPsychHtmlKeyboardResponse,\r\n            stimulus: \'+\',\r\n            choices: "NO_KEYS",\r\n            trial_duration: 500\r\n        },\r\n        {\r\n            type: jsPsychHtmlKeyboardResponse,\r\n            stimulus: jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'name\'),\r\n            trial_duration: 1000,\r\n            choices: "NO_KEYS"\r\n        },\r\n        {\r\n            type: jsPsychHtmlKeyboardResponse,\r\n            stimulus: function(){\r\n                var html = `\r\n\t\t<img src="${jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'face\')}">\r\n\t\t<p>${jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'name\', true)}</p>`;\r\n                return html;\r\n            },          \r\n            choices: "NO_KEYS",\r\n            trial_duration: 2500\r\n        }\r\n    ],\r\n    timeline_variables: [\r\n        { face: \'person-1.jpg\', name: \'Alex\' },\r\n        { face: \'person-2.jpg\', name: \'Beth\' },\r\n        { face: \'person-3.jpg\', name: \'Chad\' },\r\n        { face: \'person-4.jpg\', name: \'Dave\' }\r\n    ]\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nThis is related to [this thread] (https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/discussions/2619), and I did try that solution as well, but it gave the same results  (replacing the stimulus with `stimulus : () => { return "Test name: " + jsPsych.timelineVariable("name") + "?"; },` \r\n\r\n\r\nThe work-around I\'ve been doing is to write independent functions which first iterate over the timeline_variables array, building the parameters that need to involve multiple variables, and then passing the final product as a timeline_variable. This way, no parameters are created dynamically in the actual plugin part: each parameter can be accessed with `jsPsych.timelineVariable()`. An example is below; however, it will not work for users who want to do truly dynamic parameters (e.g. make them dependent upon a participants\' previous response).\r\n\r\nI also would just like to understand what I\'m doing wrong when implementing the solution from the docs: Is there maybe some magic to how JsPsych should be initiated, to let jsPsych know that it should delay evaluating the variables until runtime? \r\n\r\nThank you for your help! \r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nHacky work-around e.g. if you need to create a stimulus from multiple trial parameters: \r\n```\r\nconst jsPsych = initJsPsych();\r\n\r\n\r\nlet timeline = [];\r\n\r\n\r\ntimeline_building_blocks = [\r\n\t{ face: \'person-1.jpg\', name: \'Alex\' },\r\n\t{ face: \'person-2.jpg\', name: \'Beth\' },\r\n\t{ face: \'person-3.jpg\', name: \'Chad\' },\r\n\t{ face: \'person-4.jpg\', name: \'Dave\' }\r\n]\r\n// Loop over the list of timelinevariables, and build the stimulus, other parameters you want: \r\nmy_timeline_variables = []\r\ntimeline_building_blocks.forEach(trial => {\r\n\tvar stimulus = `Here is a name: ${trial.name} and an image: <img src="${trial.face}">`;\r\n\tmy_timeline_variables.push({\r\n\t\tstimulus: stimulus,\r\n\t})\r\n});\r\n\r\n// Then push my_timeline_variables to the timeline as normal, can be accessed with jsPsych.timelineVariable()\r\n// Since the dynamic part is over:\r\nvar face_name_procedure = {\r\n\ttimeline : [\r\n\t\t{\r\n\t\t\ttype: jsPsychHtmlKeyboardResponse, \r\n\t\t\tstimulus: jsPsych.timelineVariable(\'stimulus\'),\r\n\t\t\tchoices: "NO_KEYS",\r\n\t\t}],\r\n\t\ttimeline_variables : my_timeline_variables,\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\ntimeline.push(face_name_procedure)\r\njsPsych.run(timeline);\r\n\r\n```\r\n\r\n',

  'body': 'Hi again,\r\n\r\nWe are creating an open-source platform for data collection ([Open Data Capture](https://github.com/DouglasNeuroInformatics/OpenDataCapture)) that includes support for interactive tasks. As part of the platform, we have a browser-based code editor that supports implementing arbitrary interactive tasks using various libraries (including JsPsych). I think this could be helpful for users to get started with JsPsych (even if they are not using ODC). It allows users to get started immediately with modern tools and intelisense (you can have a look at our JsPsych example [here](https://playground.opendatacapture.org/?%2BDaQVIpjEGlIAC9KA8tK9XvhKJQPh8OtlvLgAPQAaikplc3mypHKC30CGMMlwuBkcQ6hAQLA%2BcU2UCYUgAHB0ARzcRYcRApABZJIcZTiiWSqXSmWy2WibJYojCXDYTD%2BcoQbJxAEI4wPKELdBQqFxTlQ7I4pimDgdYQwWocjT4NgILQ2EIAayFNEM%%2BHEGHsTRNnIyiFH6WpvBYYl7D%2BVNWE2VQIA6B43Q0ZjME2KRSBYT0QmyBRDEoFgQgQfZSxYKRCAYURNggQw4g4GwmAQAE4nKbcWBDOIOQ%2BQxTABUwWGwOBTB0LEsxeGhjEoewzHwOIIWEYhPUIKAnm8EzjA6VM2CYEJsA0JgHjmYpphkKQdAsOJMHGedhC0KAOhoCxphxQR8HgYxNlqchoR0GwZFqUocShB4N1eB4hUoGAmFU2p8HwT1akwXiYH0DQHkICBXlXUYLABBoFmMfaFChU7hGsaQbHwTBBF8hBPW8BpTOmBZSBXJhjChF5VG%2BzZjFEOAtBvBZSkMKiFg%2BUp7GmVQHh0yhPuEbAsV61RjNUUbMEMcpKDi7APh0bAOTgB4WA5BoGB0DljweEIAVcOJUlUUhMH0AFVGITBMAmhAZN1GQFDgarBFKBhgWyYQLAUBomHKKAOCkVQcVKGbsg6Uw4G8Ux0E2GBXlKfAfo5LQYGyT04g%2BBR8FcTZPQWKFyEMQw4AaHRU1GQgmHQHEFjECAYAWShehYIPcAgKKhVeDgFgBFg4H0BRsg0YgIE0RmFjgTDyG8YwsSYVwYBgewHkoDpMABSwICh-AaAQRC2FwHiFgeJgxBkNgNuwJhpmmIUmEEaYNGmfOQk2BAbHIV4NE2VSooyexMDp151dUT1XmyfByFwYRBAeGxR3sUp9BhVwRPKLRKgsLExH0DhXAgB57FTOIFH0LE9gNAQEwC7VMCAxA4iFAoQgK4NCYA0KoKErZyBMEwBwYw3gzbkA4BABYHAtAsDEDAB4hUcTkBxKoFGrggZa1UAbBgNhygGFMDYLE5QmCGE9B7YMChUy4B0ACT0MANAaEMKoLQcAPiUHfqYUw%2BgoALCgDtUoMBXA4l1h0NRdJ9CUB0FAVwrxTAyBkFiZ0Ch0BiFwIIOAxAdBiHwBnUgHNXDkChKYbwowFivC0AsTh2ISzrFUBycoCBcCvDgBYQRpDhA4mmFg0gghUzxEwCEGwSB6pQB0L8fAqhbQFg6DYDoTANCCCupoMQp0QhBU9KMWolBtAfAeDLYwHAFCqEwK9CAAJSYWE2ACHQggLAyA%2BPzbQbAtCCGwKQaW%2B0YJFItHEEIhAdDxNIA0c%2BUA2CkA5AofmphOCYCiSqKZCw-g7LQeUKEcBPSYE9FZOAbALAsEfrUXshAVgsAWB0Ne3h8j2ABHMCw%2BhSghDYFw14hgmAJxYPYewCgPi1A4NNaYNB7z2GEFRDoHJSCUE2NkYg2AtDEH9liD45RcDjE2jCUg6AHgdSgB8QQrgqp61cFARY2AUbvjmFAbwbAoDGEwGIOABibD2FwE6ewg84hfMEAsBYvtXC4A%%2BEIwg3AhDmDAaYggpBSC7nbbIHBSg5VMPABgIQVCCCEhyXA9U4A0CbvgL0i8Fiaa0EKQwKwaDEmEEKYRTrNhxDmK4WoUhpiEEtRAcgYRSLGB1sXZZcQbCCCgD2OSc7Xg4lTKQCAxB7CKPCJgVQ2AdB2xYD%2BjQUVVAwE2F8Sg9o5gQAaFC1zZc%2BHZEMOQFgOgoo0FcB8EUghvAOoUMYFWlAATgPIGIVKNBNiYBRLUYQcBLWkABDYD4TM%2BCuCkHEfQ3gNW4Cg1CDoHRPQsAsOUX0TA2D4FKvyTYqYBa-hyzQSgcRShYhYDiMQFgYA6HKMQdlcxKCYFMDQfQNgHilHPrgH6HRwiejY9gVQCtXipkE%2BgCA-A    'merged_at': None},
  'body': 'I am planning to add the option to use camel case variables to the jspsych (see issue https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/issues/3386). To make sure this doesn\'t break any existing functionality, I think it would be a good idea to enable TypeScript strict mode (I also see this is something you want on a "lucky day"). Well, it is a lucky day!\r\n\r\nI propose to do this in stages, each adding one of the strict rules (until finally `strictNullChecks`, which is the really difficult one here). I also added eslint (only for the jspsych package) to help with some additional best practices checking. \r\n\r\nThis PR makes changes that bring the existing code into compliance with the standard TypeScript linting rules and `noUnusedLocales` TypeScript rules. \r\n\r\nI also removed the `AudioContext` hack for Safari, as it looks like `AudioContext` has been supported in Safari for a number of years now. If this is not okay, let me know I can add it back.',

If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.\n\n\n# Releases\n## @jspsych/config@3.0.1\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3401](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3401) [`db7bcf82`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/db7bcf82f6491ac8d02c7c4cf89e42d4ddcde1d9) Thanks [@jadeddelta](https://github.com/jadeddelta)! - allow JSON resolution in contrib repository for usage of package.json in versioning\n\n## jspsych@8.0.3\n\n### Patch Changes\n\n-   [#3384](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3384) [`860bbaf1`](https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/commit/860bbaf1c1995ee531f7b459749ad736099d4e57) Thanks [@joshunrau](https://github.com/joshunrau)! - Improve type definitions for randomization module\n",

  'body': 'I have just starting using this package and am really enjoying it! However, I have noticed methods are named inconsistently (some with camelCase, some with snake_case). Since this is a JavaScript package, I would propose using camelCase for all method, function, or variable names. The old snake_case names can be deprecated and aliased to the camelCase names without causing any breaking changes. If it would be helpful, I can make a PR for this.',

  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': 'The v8 ["progress bar" docs page](https://www.jspsych.org/latest/overview/progress-bar/) in the Overview section looks to be out of date. It says that you can manually update the progress bar like this:\r\n```js\r\njsPsych.progressBar.progress = 0.85;\r\n```\r\nBut the reference page shows that this has been changed to [`setProgressBar`](https://www.jspsych.org/latest/reference/jspsych/#jspsychsetprogressbar), which takes the value as an argument, like this:\r\n```js\r\njsPsych.setProgressBar(0.85);\r\n```\r\nI assume the latter is correct.',
  'closed_by': {'login': 'jodeleeuw',
   'id': 595524,

  'node_id': 'I_kwDOAEI6Y86Tvd19',
  'number': 3379,
  'title': '[jspsych.org v8 docs] Deprecated function jsPsych.addNodeToEndOfTimeline() listed in the reference',
  'user': {'login': 'jabeim',
   'id': 49572428,
   'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjQ5NTcyNDI4',
   'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/49572428?v=4',
   'gravatar_id': '',
   'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/jabeim',
   'html_url': 'https://github.com/jabeim',
   'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/jabeim/followers',
   'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/jabeim/following{/other_user}',

   'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/jabeim/received_events',
   'type': 'User',
   'user_view_type': 'public',

  'labels': [],
  'state': 'closed',
  'locked': False,
  'assignee': None,

  'milestone': None,
  'comments': 9,
  'created_at': '2024-08-21T18:12:30Z',
  'updated_at': '2024-11-20T18:49:52Z',
  'closed_at': '2024-11-20T18:48:46Z',
  'author_association': 'NONE',
  'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0},
  'active_lock_reason': None,
  'body': '[The website](https://www.jspsych.org/latest/reference/jspsych/#jspsychaddnodetoendoftimeline) lists addNodeToEndOfTimeline as jspsych method to add new timeline nodes to the end of a running timeline. This function appears to have been deprecated in v8 (but its removal is not listed in the v8 release notes). \r\n\r\nI noticed this because a v7 experiment that was working stopped after updating to v8 with an error that addNodeToEndOfTimeline is not a function.\r\n\r\n<details><summary>Details</summary>\r\n<p>\r\n<li> \r\n<a href="https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/blob/e94e6a79f018da4c3465c124f010d47333a18e95/packages/jspsych/src/JsPsych.ts#L382">addNodeToEndOfTimeline</a> in v7.3.4\r\n</li>\r\n<li>\r\n<a href="https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/blob/jspsych%408.0.2/packages/jspsych/src/JsPsych.ts">no such method</a> in v8.0.2\r\n</li>\r\n</details> \r\n\r\nIf its removal is intended the website v8 docs should be updated to remove references to it or state that its deprecated. \r\n\r\nRelated to this discrepancy:\r\nIs there an alternative method to add additional trials to the experiment dynamically now that this function is removed?\r\n\r\n',
  'closed_by': {'login': 'jodeleeuw',
   'id': 595524,
   'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjU5NTUyNA==',
   'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/595524?v=4',

   'diff_url': 'https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3368.diff',
   'patch_url': 'https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/pull/3368.patch',
   'merged_at': '2024-08-08T15:06:45Z'},
  'body': "Qualtrics have overwritten/incorrectly polyfilled `Array.from()` such that it doesn't work, and so neither does jsPsych when run directly in Qualtrics. This PR then replaces uses of `Array.from()` in jsPsych with equivalent functions. So far, a wrapped spread operator `[...array]` is used in the KeyboardResponseAPI, and `Array.prototype.slice.call()` in the `maxdiff` and `free-sort` plugins. \r\n\r\nThere's also a single `Array.from()` call in `packages/plugin-sketchpad/src/index.ts`, although I can't get this to run on my own fork even in the original version outside of Qualtrics. It also features heavily in the webgazer examples and demos.\r\n\r\nProbably worth considering this doesn't do much for any extension, anything in contrib, or Survey-js etc, so Qualtrics compatibility isn't guaranteed, but atleast the core library can be used without dealing with an extra hosting site.\r\n\r\nFollows from https://github.com/jspsych/jsPsych/discussions/3347.",

title: matplotlib demo
text:
Hello, this page will showcase the main dashboard!


Code
#Initializing Workspace
import requests
import datetime
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

#API Function
def fetch_api(endpoint):
 url = f"https://api.github.com/repos/jspsych/jsPsych/{endpoint}"
 final_data=[]
 while url:
  response = requests.get(url)
  data = response.json()
  for item in data:
    final_data.append(item)
  if 'next' in response.links:
    url = response.links['next']['url']
  else:
    break

  return final_data
This page will show the dashboard for discussions
